result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew D Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew D Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Andrew D Harris.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status conference. MATTER HELD OFF THE RECORD.  Defense has received all discovery and requests adjourned Status conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.   Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew D Harris in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Andrew D Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense has received some discovery and requests a Status conference be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew D Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court in person for Andrew D Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Rom. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defenses requests an Arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Arraignment scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew D Harris in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; unavailable (day off and others on special assignment). Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andrew D Harris in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Andrew D Harris in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew D Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew D Harris
Current: 120 E National Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 5633 West Rogers Street, Milwaukee, WI 53219
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
